intro: Androtrichum trigynum, commonly known as the three-styled androtrichum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Androtrichaceae. It is characterized by its small, inconspicuous flowers and is typically found in moist, shaded environments. The plant has a compact growth habit with dense foliage, and its leaves are usually arranged in a rosette pattern. Androtrichum trigynum is notable for its unique reproductive structures, featuring three distinct styles in its flowers. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
